newsitem.title: MEXICO: Fidel Velazquez "improving" in hospital - doctor.
newsitem.headline: Fidel Velazquez "improving" in hospital - doctor.

text.p: Mexican labor boss Fidel Velazquez, 96 years old, was in improved condition on Thursday, resting comfortably in his hospital room, his doctor aid.
"He's better," Salomon Jasqui told Reuters. "He's perfectly fine in his room."
Jasqui had listed Velazquez in "good condition" on Wednesday, saying he had contracted the E coli bacteria after eating contaminated food.
Velazquez is the powerful leader of the six-million-strong Mexican Workers Confederation (CTM), which has swung unionized labor behind the government for more than half a century.
He was hospitalized last month with an intestinal infection and last October with a lung infection.
